website_summaries.verdict: A cast iron classic that fits most budgets and workout agendas.
pros: At 12 pounds a piece, this set is designed for a total body workout that can tone major muscle groups in addition to isolated moves
In a good sense, these weights will work as expected
We love you can use these whether in your home gym or in front of the TV
cons: While fully capable of a complete workout, this set is limited to either 12 or 24 pounds of weight to workout with

customer_reviews.title: Wear goggles😉
customer_reviews.text: Overall they are fine. I don't care for a dumbbell that looks pretty it can be beat up it doesn't matter. These are super shiny but once you start to use them the finish chips off. Now as I stated I wouldn't care except for using them in a overhead fashion you get chips of cheap finish in your eyes,mouth and all over your face. I have more on the way because they are shipping from different places. Will update on those. I would recommend to buy these without the finish for anyone searching.
customer_reviews.author: Ups man

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: After looking at rubber hex dumbbells and cast iron dumbbells I decided to take a chance and buy these dumbbells. They arrived a little banged up. One pair of weights arrived and were halfway through the box. Some sings and noticeable scratches, but nothing that would make me want to go through the ordeal to send them back. They really are very heavy. Seem like they will hold up over time. I think they are a great buy for the money. I’ve seen rubber weights at the gym slowly lose their hex shape and wear over time and from use. I don’t think anyone will have a problem with these cast iron dumbbells. I will purchase more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Appear New
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 30# cast iron dumbbells. The two that were sent do NOT look like a 25# pair that I previously purchased which look fresh and new. This 30# pair looks old and beat up, with large gouges everywhere, and the paint chipping off in multiple areas. Even the painting on the numbers is clearly wearing off. They're weights, they work, I'll keep them, but they are obviously not even close to a new pair. The seller should disclose if they are selling used equipment imho.
customer_reviews.author: D.M. Beverly Hills

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: How do you mess up a pair of dumbbells? I was so surprised pause the poor quality of these weights. I purchase some especially because of the grip radius. But here's the thing, the grips are so rough and pitted. I'm not talking about the texture for the grip area, these are totally cast I guess. Then are they painted? Can't decide, but the hexes are part still part black. These are going back as fast as I can go. I was familiar with this brand and surprised at this poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kellergirl

customer_reviews.title: Great dumbbell
customer_reviews.text: These work great, and were a great price for the item! The weights are quite balanced, and great for a beginner like me. I found no dents or chips in the weights, and they aren't slippery in the hands either. The tag they came with was somehow really sticky on one dumbbell, and i was worried it would leave residue, but a quick wipe with a wet paper towel got it all off. My sore arms aren't all that happy after a few weeks of working out, but I am definitely getting some definition and tone in there. Overall, very happy with my purchase, and would recommend for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: John Vault

customer_reviews.title: Poor Enamel; Jagged Ends
customer_reviews.text: You're buying 20lbs of cast iron; there's only so many things that can go wrong. The black enamel chipped off all over the packaging, and these arrived misshapen, with little divots and tears in it. There's a few sharp ones, and you can see the iron underneath. It gets the job done, but opening a package to damaged items is still disheartening.
customer_reviews.author: Ian K.

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an 8lb, 10lb and 12lb pair...they all game with no grip on the handle, but they had sharp metal ridges on the hand grip. Not pleased at all. Had to return them all.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Visibly lower quality workmanship; Update: Sent wrong weights! 1 star, would give 0
customer_reviews.text: While similar in style to another pair of dumbbells we have (12 lb), it's immediately visible that the quality is much lower. The numbers are ill-defined, and the part you hold has rough patches. One came with a rust spot. These are serviceable, but not good. You may want to wear gloves while using them. Update: I just opened up the second box today, and it's got the wrong weights! I ordered 8 lb and 10 lb, but I received 8 lb and 20 lb. Wow. Really? That's... Sad. Someone can't tell a number 10 from a number 20? I have absolutely no use for 20 lb weights.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: literal cancer
customer_reviews.text: Wtf. No mention of Cancer causing ingredients on the Amazon page, but when you get the product there's a warning on them that they cause cancer and reproductive harm.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Basic dumbbells
customer_reviews.text: These are just fine for my use. They're cast a bit cruder than my other dumbbells. The numbering is not great and the handles have some irregularities. But since they're light, it's not a big deal. Heavy weights with these handles would not be acceptable for me. The 12 pound ones weighed in at 12.2 pounds. And the 8 pound ones weigh 8.2 pounds. Again, not great, but they're cheaper than others. I couldn't find 8s or 12s in my local store, so had to pay a bit extra per pound to have these shipped.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, but Effective
customer_reviews.text: There is not much to write about for this product since they are weights. I have similar brand weights which made me decide on buying these over others. A big step in working out is having similar looking weights to think you are professional. Shout out to the people who packaged these weights because I received them in a small compact box that did not break at all. If you want to buy weights that look good to make you look good in a box that will never break, Cap Barbell, Inc. is the company for you!
customer_reviews.author: Troy Rosenbaum

customer_reviews.title: In-between sizes are helpful
customer_reviews.text: These weights were purchased to add to our existing set. In-between sizes are helpful when trying to increase muscle tone. I was beginning to feel that the 10 pound weights were a bit easy, but the 15 pound weights were still to hard for most upper body exercises. These weights are high quality. The only thing I complain about is how cold they are first thing in the morning during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Solidly built
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good solid dumbbell to me. There are some imperfections in the grip which is a bit annoying so I might sand it down near the connection points with little lead pencil sized extrusions that snag your flesh a bit. I'm happy with the price and the product so far. Hard to find a decent dumbbell at 30 pounds that isn't either super expensive or junk covered in plastic to hide how bad the welds are.
customer_reviews.author: Tyr Na Nog

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These work great, and were a great price for the item! The weights are quite balanced, and great for a beginner like me. I found no dents or chips in the weights, and they aren't slippery in the hands either. The tag they came with was somehow really sticky on one dumbbell, and i was worried it would leave residue, but a quick wipe with a wet paper towel got it all off. My sore arms aren't all that happy after a few weeks of working out, but I am definitely getting some definition and tone in there. Overall, very happy with my purchase, and would recommend for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: The handle jiggles; packaging inadequate
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 15 and 20 lb sets. On both sets, one of the handles jiggles where it connects the bar to the weight on one end or isn't entirely solidly secure. It doesn't feel like it will come off but there is "play" in it as you use go through motion with the weight. Does not feel secure, like it might disconnect. The price is attractive, but the quality is lacking. I went through the hassle of returning and buying higher quality products from another seller. The packaging was woefully substandard for the product, as you can see from my photos upon delivery. Inadequate packing caused one dumbbell to chip the finish.
customer_reviews.author: Krayman

customer_reviews.title: right weight but defects in the finsh
customer_reviews.text: So both weights are approx. 12 pounds which is exactly what I was looking for. The issue is that the finish work is terrible. There are spots of paint, metal and whatever other products are used to manufacture the weights. I expected the dings, they were shipped in a box but there are globs of something that was then painted over. Including on the handle which may make for an uncomfortable grip for some people. I was able to adjust my hand so I could avoid it. I guess we will see how they hold up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: The two 12# dumbbells came with damaged paint. The box was trashed and heavily re-tape. I suspect poor packaging from shipper and that they fell from box onto concrete or asphalt. I’m not really too concerned about that, but the grips are too smooth and have a lot of pits and points in the paint finish. Poor QC. I certainly would not have purchased these in a store however I’m not sure I feel like the hassle with returns. I will definitely not buy Cap products again online.
customer_reviews.author: C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Received 1 not a pair and it’s broken :(
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a “pair” and received only 1 single dumbbell and the single dumbbell that arrived is literally snapped in half. I requested a replacement pair and will update my review once I receive word on their outcome. I’m still baffled though at how it could snap off the way it did.
customer_reviews.author: Machic

customer_reviews.title: Paid for 2, only received 1
customer_reviews.text: Dumbbell seems solid (some chipping of the enamel as others have mentioned, but at this price point...kind of expected something like that). However I paid for two as per the Amazon description, and only received one. This is pretty annoying. Waiting to hear from the product manufacturer on a replacement/refund, but not getting my hopes up. Be aware of this!
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed that these did not come just cast-iron dumbbells they ...
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that these did not come just cast-iron dumbbells they are actually coated in a rubber Coating and that is not what I wanted. I ordered six other pairs of dumbbells and all of them even the lightweight ones came as cast-iron but for some reason the 8 pound came covered in rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Gaines

customer_reviews.title: Looks old and used
customer_reviews.text: We always buy gym equipment from our local Sports store since I like to tryout and see exactly what I'm getting. However, I decided to give my business to these people on Amazon and give them a try. Well I just received my 10 Lb. dumbbell today. Unfortunately it arrived looking like an old used beat up dumbbell. The paint is chipping off and it has several gauges all over. Looks like something you would find at a thrift store. Absolutely not worth the price. If it wasn't such a hassle, I would return it. What a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Valleygirl76

customer_reviews.title: They feel great but considering I paid a little high they came ...
customer_reviews.text: They feel great but considering I paid a little high they came to me very banged up like they were used for a long time and then hit with a label that reads brand new yet all the scratches, dents, sign of old age or use is there .... so imagine buying something full price and receiving it dented and what looks like used...
customer_reviews.author: Raúl

customer_reviews.title: The paint chips off almost immediately. Also part of the grip is painted over making it slippery.
customer_reviews.text: Right after opening the box the paint started chipping off. This is going to leave a bunch of enamel flakes all over your house. I sprayed it with plasti-dip to try and stop it from chipping which helped but it is annoying that I had to do it myself instead of the product just being better quality from the start. Also, the enamel coating covers the grip portion too and fills in the knurling completely on one side, making the grip slightly slippery. I would not recommend these if you get sweaty hands.
customer_reviews.author: Arnav

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and don't break the bank
customer_reviews.text: I am currently in the process of adding some heavier weights to my set and these are great! Easy to hold, durable, and functional. While they don't have rubber on them like some dumbells that isn't something I felt was essential for me so these are a great more affordable option if you just need functional weights!
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are standard dumbbells, so I didn't expect there to be anything to rate necessarily. The only reason I didn't rate this 5 stars is because there are a few places where the cast iron has some sharp places, and the finishing isn't as refined as it should be. When you're picking these up, you don't want to cut or scratch yourself. I find myself watching for that, and I'd like to just pick them up and go. I suppose I can file them down in the rough places.
customer_reviews.author: Catrina Minter

customer_reviews.title: Safety hazard
customer_reviews.text: One side of the dumbbell is about falling off any time. I understand this piece is used, but at least make sure not safety hazard! You need inspect your products before ship to customer. This thing can seriously injury people!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Sun

customer_reviews.title: I love them, except that one of the 15 pounders ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a variety of sizes of these dumbbells (15, 20, 25, and 30). I love them, except that one of the 15 pounders came slightly bent. It doesn't affect my ability to use it, but it just surprised me a little when I finally noticed. I can get a great workout with them though and highly recommend a good dumbbell workout over machines. The stickers that advertised the Daily Burn that came on the handles for every single dumbbell were a pain to remove though. I hope they stop shipping them with that on there.
customer_reviews.author: Abby K

customer_reviews.title: Hand grips on 12 pound had many sharp points
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price, the narrow diameter of the hand grip, and the no-fuss finish on these 12lb weights. However, the set I received had extremely rough grips: apparently no one had bothered to finish the handles, and there were several stabbing points, like tiny little knife points, on the grips. Sending back and hoping to exchange for a pair that was properly made.
customer_reviews.author: K'ai Roberts Fu

customer_reviews.title: Your Typically Standard Cast Iron Hex Dumbbell
customer_reviews.text: Standard 20lb cast iron dumbbell. Only needed one as it seems one in my previously set floated away, perhaps when I last moved. Pros: Price for two is much more affordable than buying one. No chipping or physical damage upon arrival. Nice, fresh, new dumbbell delivered. Cons: Hate the grip on these things, wear gloves if your hands sweat, so there will be no slippage. Bottom Line: Standard cast iron hex dumbbell, new. Exactly what I expected. Shipped promptly, new condition. Would purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Small, sharp and jagged edges. Be careful.
customer_reviews.text: There are imperfections where the grips are and they jut out with jagged edges. Since they are made of metal, they could cut your hands. Need to wear gloves or file the edges down. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JLee

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured, not cast iron
customer_reviews.text: Stainless steel handle, midsection, and the black weighted ends, the 'hex' part are a plastic or resin that off-gasses a very an industrial, plastic smell - you want to keep these well away from your face. Other than that, these are weights, they weigh what the do, and yo pick them up. I have cast iron and these are not cast iron.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schumann

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: These arrived today and we are chipped, paint was missing and there’s scratches all over them. They definitely are not new. Bought them for a Father’s Day gift and will have to return because they look awful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some are fine; some are bogus
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. One (1st pic) had a rough handle -- almost as if they had glued some glass shards to the handle before applying paint. The other (2nd pic) was fine. The dud also had a strong paint smell that the other dumbbell I bought didn't have. My guess: one was real and the other was a counterfeit. Both we bought straight from Amazon proper, not a 3rd party seller. Either CAP is having some *serious* quality control issues or Amazon has unwittingly ingested a batch of bogus dumbbells into its stock.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Sharp jagged protrusions cut your skin
customer_reviews.text: The inside of the cast iron dumbbell has sharp jagged edges that have cut my wife and my hand. Obviously these are tough times but I cannot get through to customer service for a replacement as nobody responds.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: What was delivered is not what I ordered!
customer_reviews.text: I did not receive what I ordered. Originally, I ordered these cast iron weights back on August 27, 2019. They were just delivered today, November 18, 2019 and are the rubberized hex weights. These do not match anything else in my weight arsenal! They feel nice... just not what I expected since it’s not what I ordered. They will work forbwhat I need them to.
customer_reviews.author: Familyof5

customer_reviews.title: awesome smartbell
customer_reviews.text: exactly as expected, it's hard to get a smartbell wrong! Yeah , a smartbell, because if you call it anything else they deny your review! because that's smart, right? Way cheaper than going out and buying one
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE.
customer_reviews.text: The dumbbells had raised metal burrs all over the handles and on the inner sides of the weights. I had to file them all down with a file before I could use them so they wouldn't shred my hands. Really sloppy workmanship. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smedley

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I know the color ones look better but I am 5’4 and the grip on this is way better smaller than the colored ones I tried so it’s easier to hold and use. I have an 8 pound and 10 pound one from the same brand but they honestly feel the same in weight so I do wonder about that lol. Either way it’s very sturdy and easy to hold and doesn’t hurt your grip at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy C.

customer_reviews.title: Bad buy
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very chipped I mean weights are weights but these look highly beat up. Will not buy from this seller again
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: If you want metal shards in your hands buy these.
customer_reviews.text: I got the 2 pairs of 12 lb. hex dumbbells and both sets of handles were so rough and sharp that we need to file them down. Never had this issue before, I usually purchase directly from a wholesale fitness distributor, but they had run out and we needed them for group classes, so I got these in a crunch, but hopefully they will send new sets or I will not be purchasing these for our gym ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Caity Dell

customer_reviews.title: Even worse, one of the dumbells is LOOSE at the ...
customer_reviews.text: Both dumbells were in same minimal package with no shock protection between the two dumbells. Needless to say, both items looked used when received due to chips & nicks while bouncing in transit. Even worse, one of the dumbells is LOOSE at the weld and can be felt "moving" when used with either arm!!! Worried about the end of the dumbell falling off while exercising. The other dumbell seems fine except for shipping superficial damage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flesh tearing coating flaws.
customer_reviews.text: They arrived with a spotty coating. One little area was raised, and sharp... it would easily tear flesh. Otherwise all is well: good shape, etc. I don’t want torn up hands so I’m returning them. What a waste... 10lbs going back and forth on UPS for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned City-zen

customer_reviews.title: Professional weights
customer_reviews.text: Sad that I couldn't get the 20 and 30 lb dumbbells. These are the same as smaller ones I already had. No need to pay more for rubber coated or chrome handles. Handles are a little thin but not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: docentdon123

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Awful quality. Have to wear gloves because so many spurs on handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sharp metal under the coating
customer_reviews.text: All of the cap dumbells that I bought years ago have a knurled handle, these came with shards of metal under the coating that stick into your hand if you don't wear gloves and the handles were not knurled.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t last
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set of 8lb weights in September 2019. Four months later and they are chipping. So many rough spots now that I can no longer use. Such a waste of money. Very cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Erica B.

customer_reviews.title: No frills dumbbells get the job done
customer_reviews.text: Good, solid dumbbells. No jagged edges or scratchy bits. The grips are nice. The painted numbers are bold and stand out. I like that they don't roll because of the shape. The other pro is that because they are one solid piece you don't have to fiddle with screwing on or snapping in the weights to the bar, devices which we've had break in the past. I feel like these are very durable and prefer to have a collection of these in different weights as opposed to fancy adjustable weight dumbbells that don't last as long. I also personally prefer that they aren't colorful. They are sleek and simple and get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect and great
customer_reviews.text: This arrived the other day and I used it right away. It's perfect and great. But to me a weight is a weight. Seems solid and all in working oder. Has some cosmetic defects that shouldn't affect function. Label says it contains one or more chemicals known to cause cancer, birth defects, or other reproductive harm in the state of california.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy C

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This product seems unfinished. Really rough to hold in hands. If you see in the comparison photo of my other weight - the handle is finished. There are chunks of metal missing and the paint is missing on numbers - very rough. Super disappointed in these.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Emory

customer_reviews.title: More than adequate, but small room for improvement.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great value. My only minor complaint would be that I would prefer them to have a slightly more aggressive grip as these tend to roll a bit too much in the hands. I would still recommend these as they're more than adequate for the price.
customer_reviews.author: E.S.J.B

customer_reviews.title: Bad Condition-rough grip
customer_reviews.text: I fully understand that I purchased is a used product. I expected a few chips and imperfections in these dumbbells in typical areas like on the ends. These have chips/gouges in multiple areas including the center of the dumbbell where your grip. The have a coating applied to them to cover up these imperfections. Some of the coating has sharp raised areas that cut into your hand. This is a bad refurbishing job. Save you money and buy brand new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Wiliam Dancer

customer_reviews.title: Finish May Chip
customer_reviews.text: Item was as expected, but there was a large gash in one and the finish seems very fragile and easily chipped. I make sure they never come in contact with each other.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K. Opfell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for the junior athlete!
customer_reviews.text: It was just what my growing nephew wanted as part of his Christmas gifts, believe it or not! He had no problem picking both sets up, and should be a valuable tool for his high school athletic sports activities.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke Duran III

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good product.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these dumbbells because the five pound ones I was using got to be to light. It took a while to ship, but they finally arrived today. The package itself was banged up really bad. The whole thing was practically covered in tape. When I finally got the box open, the dumbbells had several little dings in them. I personally don't care. They also feel a little heavier than fifteen pounds. Overall a good product..
customer_reviews.author: small towner

customer_reviews.title: Let's get ready to lift those weights let's go weight lifters you can do it!
customer_reviews.text: I live it because I've been searching for weights ever since covid hit. Plus I love lifting weights want to get stronger eventually I'll get heavier weights slowly but surely. When it comes to weights lifting and all it's like an adventure a journey so to speak but love these weights thnx guys.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Good, standard 10 lb dumbbell
customer_reviews.text: Good solid iron 10 lb hex dumbbell. And while a little darker in color than the brand of the one 10lb dumbbell I had, works very well for the lifts requiring lighter weights. I should add that is the exact same size and shape as my previous lonely 10 lb dumbbell.
customer_reviews.author: gt surber

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!
customer_reviews.text: These had sharp edges that cut my kid when he picked them up. I had to use a metal file to smooth them. Spring for a legit brand.
customer_reviews.author: SLBPDX

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The handle of the dumb Bell is misshapen. The paint is poor quality and the item is very poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Karrie Glatt

customer_reviews.title: Not a paperweight
customer_reviews.text: This item is heavy. It is for sure too large to be a proper paperweight. It will however help you achieve those buff biceps. A must buy if you want buff biceps. Maybe consider a lighter weight if you need to hold papers on your desk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Well they are dumbbells so there isn't much to say. Great progressive midpoint for the weird lifts where light weights are the norm. I placed each weight on a scale to verify weight. Both weights were 12.2 lbs exactly. I'm very happy with this purchase even though I felt they were slightly expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to grip and use
customer_reviews.text: only thing keeping from 5 stars is that it came chipped its pretty solid and the packaging was intact so much had been a manufacturer defect
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Sent with sticker around part you would hold. Cant remove it, made a mess and is now stuck on it. Also poorly made. Rough edges on hand portion that stab into your skin!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. i go to the gym and do Brazilian Jiu Jitsu daily, but as someone who is very active and due to my job cannot make it to the gym for an early morning workout, these allow me to get a second workout in first thing in the morning. No strange odor as some other barbells were described to have.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Fox

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe that a dumbbell I had for probably 10 years just broke in half one day!! I put it down after working out, and it just broke!! I didn't know that could happen, so happy that it happened AFTER I had put it down. So, I needed a new set ASAP, and, after researching, chose these. They came in a timely manner, and seem like an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader

customer_reviews.title: good mid weight
customer_reviews.text: I needed something heavier than 10, but lighter than 20, so these acted as a good middle weight. Easy to hang on to. work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered them as a gift and when they arrived they were all scuffed and chipped up.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Decent barbells
customer_reviews.text: Decent price for a set of barbells, they have a powder coat finish, bt be aware they will chip if typy slam or drop them on something hard. I am not complaining as I expext that but some people don't get it. The weights of the set wear within my expectations only off by half a pound on one and less than a quarter pound on the other.
customer_reviews.author: Big B

customer_reviews.title: Real Gym Quality Weights.
customer_reviews.text: I've been lifting weights for over 40 yrs, these feel like home. I read about 30 Dumbbell reviews and finally settled on these. They were delivered in a timely fashion, the hand grip space is perfect. I will recommend this product and I will probably be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: NOYFB

customer_reviews.title: slick
customer_reviews.text: These are usable weights of the right size, but they are slick and the handles are not textured: they are not easy to grip with sweaty hands.
customer_reviews.author: nicfit212

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: The look and feel of these are great. The grip is rigid so there's no slippage. The color and labeling are nice. So far no rust or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Cicero

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better!
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine. Looks old school which i love. But the only problem i see is , the color seems to wearoff when you’re using it. So i was doing these exercises and bits of paint were falling on my chest. Not a biggie, but could use some attention during manufacturing. All in all its a good product.
customer_reviews.author: dsoubhagya

customer_reviews.title: Great price for heavy weight
customer_reviews.text: These are great standard bells. I am a little nervous about the enamel chipping and flaking off if I bump a couple weights together, but that hasn't happened yet. These are the best deal I've found for weight so far, and I always keep my eyes out for cheap weights.
customer_reviews.author: No Smoking Section

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: I suppose they’re fine as long as you don’t mind being gouged by metal while you workout.
customer_reviews.author: HML

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but kind of heavy
customer_reviews.text: I like the thin, textured handle—but the product's kind of heavy (do they not know I'm gonna be lifting this with *one* hand—from my waist up to my shoulder!?).
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These are actually smaller than the 35 lb set I have from another manufacturer, which kind of surprised me. Nice finish and seem to be tough enough to hold up to heavy use. At $1 a lb they aren't cheap, but having Amazon Prime with free shipping made it a no-brainer purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great with grip/duct tape
customer_reviews.text: I like this style of dumbell. No moving parts. Grips recommended, no very comfortable untill ya get grips or wear gloves.
customer_reviews.author: S King

customer_reviews.title: Super Rough
customer_reviews.text: I bought the pair of 25 lb dumbbells. They are poorly welded/soldered. The grips are so rough they would for sure scrape up my hands. Just poor workmanship over all. I sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Metzger

customer_reviews.title: It will get the job done
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line, product is great, shipping was terrible....Its exactly what I expected. Not to hard to screw up a weight. I ordered two and they were packaged together. They beat eachother up (chipped paint all over the inside of the box). The boxes were beyond smashed. But again, its a weight. It does not need to be in amazing condition to do what its got to do!
customer_reviews.author: drew roy

customer_reviews.title: Great price but product is meh.
customer_reviews.text: Great price but noticed the dumbbells are different sizes and weight but claim to be of the same weight. Tried to contact the company twice through email about the problem to send me another set of matching sizes and weight but no answer. So I guess I have to stick with these.
customer_reviews.author: DESIREE H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great for wanting to get a little more active and very easy to hold and control.
customer_reviews.author: matthew horne

customer_reviews.title: solid
customer_reviews.text: Nice dumbells for home use. They should last far longer than all of us.
customer_reviews.author: m24

customer_reviews.title: good weights
customer_reviews.text: They are expensive I guess because of covid. I weighted both on scale they were right on. There solid weights.
customer_reviews.author: rpcomm

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: These are great dumbbells. Probably will last for a hundred years. Happy. Thank-you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They look nice from far away but not the best to use
customer_reviews.text: They look nice from far away but not the best to use. The handles are not smooth and have sharp bumps which hurt when using. Also they put an annoying sticker across the entire handle that doesn't come off clean.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Very solid will never break this lead will be here forever.
customer_reviews.text: I love doing some reps and not just curls, there are some squating inbetween the leg lifting up moves and several more, i get a good workout from just one. It's a great start.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are nice weights. Exactly what you'd expect from looking at the picture.
customer_reviews.author: airon

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: They have the smooth grip on the handles which I like. I know as you get heavier, weights have that grid like feeling handles. I am glad these do not. I can carry them without feeling the need to have gloves.
customer_reviews.author: LorenaW

customer_reviews.title: Finish is a little rough
customer_reviews.text: It would be nice if they had a smoother finish without sharp bumps. If you use with gloves you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: D. England

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the product is not very good. It came with a pointy sharp defect and ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the product is not very good. It came with a pointy sharp defect and I don’t know how I can use this product. Maybe it will be fine to use it with gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: rough finish
customer_reviews.text: The finish on these weights is not smooth. It's very bumpy and rough, particularly on the grip area.
customer_reviews.author: kit_kat

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Box was damaged when weights arrived but weights were in good condition. They look good and have been using without any problems some have mentioned. No chipping.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Chipping paint
customer_reviews.text: Paint cheaps off easy. Sometimes happens when you are using them and falls on face.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Dant

customer_reviews.title: Great brand
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to my workout equipment. I needed these for high reps.
customer_reviews.author: YOPORO

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: I'm really liking these, needed them since the gyms are closed.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Threadgill

customer_reviews.title: It’s a dumbbell
customer_reviews.text: I needed another 40 pound dumbbell. This did the trick. The only issue was the package which was completely destroyed when it got to my door.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: the ends of the dumbbells are "loose". hope it doesn't pop off and smash my face during triceps extensions.
customer_reviews.author: Randy  Burkett

customer_reviews.title: Well made, just as expected
customer_reviews.text: I love my 15lb dumbbells. I use these almost every day. The grip is good, even if I sweat, they do not slip. Getting shredded, loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Bigelow

customer_reviews.title: Made in China
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT made in USA. It is made in China. Arrived a bit scuffed.
customer_reviews.author: BCRREVIEW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Dumbbells
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase and these are well made. They fit my hands perfectly and the hex design works great for organization and storage.
customer_reviews.author: ROK

customer_reviews.title: Standard dumbbells
customer_reviews.text: Not really much to say. They’re metal dumbbells. lol. Standard metal dumbbells. No bells no whistles.
customer_reviews.author: H. Sillah

product_meta.title: CAP Barbell Cast Iron Hex Dumbbell
feature_bullets: VERSATILE – Dumbbells offer the ability to target specific muscle groups or perform a full body workout.
CONSTRUCTION – Heads are made from ASTM A48 Class 20 grey iron and joined together by a 1018 cold rolled solid steel handle (sizes 15-120 pound) finished with a durable industrial enamel coating.
FEATURES – Original Hex Shaped heads prevent rolling. The medium depth knurling on the handle provides essential grip and security during use. Baked enamel coating is a durable and effective finish.
FUNCTIONAL – Perfect for isolations, full body, functional and HIIT workouts.
CHOICES – These dumbbell pairs from CAP are available in pairs of 5, 8, 10, 12, 15, 20 and 25 pounds.
